Description: Rim and body sherd of Chian pottery Ionian cup with everted rim; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; two added white lines; exterior: wide band at top of lip; line at top of handle zone; three bands preserved on lower wall.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the decoration, see Boardman, J., Excavations in Chios 1952-1955. Greek Emporio. Annual of the British School at Athens Supplement 6. Oxford 1967, 127-8, no. 376, fig. 78. Boardman's Type D matches Williams' (1983, 179) Aegina Type B cups. Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1916) (phase 2)
Williams 2006a / The Chian Pottery from Naukratis (p. 132 note 63)
